intro: Tanaecium revillae, commonly known as the Revilla's tanaecium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
